bibl.title: Sadder than Simonidean Tears: Cornificius and Simonides in Catullus 38. Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: Catullus' poem 38 is not a request for consolatory verses from Cornificius in the vein of Simonides, but for some verses from his epyllion, the Glaucus. The so-called "new Simonides" [P. Oxy. XXII, 2327 [= M.-P.3 1459.1; LDAB 3915); LIX, 3965 (= M.-P.3 1459.11; LDAB 3919)] reveals Simonides' appropriateness as a model for epic-like verses.
KOWERSKI Lawrence M., Sadder than Simonidean Tears: Cornificius and Simonides in Catullus 38. Avec résumé en anglais.
